Package frogger_main

Class obstacleFactory

java.lang.Object
frogger_main.obstacleFactory
public class obstacleFactory
extends java.lang.Object
This class is in charge of initializing all obstacles attached to the root node
Author:
karim

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Actor> digits
    Array to keep track of the digits on the screen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    obstacleFactory()
    The constructor does nothing but initiates a list that keeps track of all digits on stage

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addobjects​(MyStage background)
    This is the main method of this class and its called to from other classes to initiates all objects in the scene after it runs the instantiating functions, it shuffles the adder array which contain all moving objects and add them to the background to make the obstacles spawn randomly in different dimension when the level is changed
    void setNumber​(int n, boolean highpos)
    This method manages the digits used for the score and highscore on top of the screen

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • digits

      public java.util.ArrayList<Actor> digits
      Array to keep track of the digits on the screen

  • Constructor Details

    • obstacleFactory

      public obstacleFactory()
      The constructor does nothing but initiates a list that keeps track of all digits on stage

  • Method Details

    • addobjects

      public void addobjects​(MyStage background)
      This is the main method of this class and its called to from other classes to initiates all objects in the scene after it runs the instantiating functions, it shuffles the adder array which contain all moving objects and add them to the background to make the obstacles spawn randomly in different dimension when the level is changed
      Parameters:
      background - This is the root node of the scene, all objects need to be attached to it as a child

    • setNumber

      public void setNumber​(int n, boolean highpos)
      This method manages the digits used for the score and highscore on top of the screen
      Parameters:
      n - This is the number to be displayed as digits
      highpos - This boolean tells the method if it should place the digits under score or under highscore(if true then under highscore) it also deleted all current score digits from the screen before updating them
